makes a film I'm very curious to see
what it is because he's directed a lot
of really great movies and I really
admired the way he makes films all of
his films feel very meticulously planned
every shot feels like it has a purpose
and he's also extremely good at blending
CG elements with real-world elements and
making it seamless allied has a lot of
good things going for it namely the
production design the costume design the
entire look and feel of this movie feels
like you're watching a movie that was
made in the 40s it takes place in 1942
and various years after that as the
movie progresses throughout the story
but this film feels extremely
old-fashioned in that it's slow-moving
just the way characters move around the
frame and the way they talk to each
other and the way the camera will
sometimes linger on an actor way longer
than most Hollywood movies you can
really get the sense that Robert
Zemeckis is trying to recreate that
golden era of Hollywood the 40s and
really make it feel that way sometimes
that's a detriment to this movie as well
because there's obvious influence from
the movie Casablanca here and sometimes
it becomes a hindrance because you just
keep seeing how much he's tributing that
film and other films of the era that
this film doesn't always become its own
film because it's trying to be so many
other films as well if you're excited
about the idea of an old-fashioned style
romance with two really attractive
people who are good at acting and a
great director allied will probably be
enough for you but for me personally I
was let down by the way this film was
paced there wasn't a sense of urgency to
their relationship there wasn't that
romantic intensity that I was looking
for it felt a little bland
which then bled over into the pacing of
the movie in regards to certain scenes
that just went on and on certain
sequences it felt like they could be cut
down significantly like there's a scene
where Brad Pitt is called in to
who talked to some people in secret and

about five shots of him walking down a

it moves across the staircase and you
see down all the way to the bottom of
the floor then there's a long tracking
shot of him walking through the hallway
looking at people going like yes hello
then there's another shot of him walking
through a hallway very slowly and then
eventually we get to the room where he

I'm wondering why they had to have all
of those shots showing him walking
through these hallways and you guys know

it's just a gorgeous shot and yeah Brad

the comparisons I kept making the
